protocol_name: True-Nuclear™ Transcription Factor Staining Protocol for 5 mL Tubes
protocol_name_html: True-Nuclear™ Transcription Factor Staining Protocol for 5 mL Tubes
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"cgcv5","text":"General Tips and FAQ:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":21,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j2b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmiu9","text":"What are some improvements in the True-Nuclear™ Buffer compared to the Foxp3 Fix/Perm (Cat. No. 421403) and the Nuclear Factor Fixation and Permeabilization Buffer Sets (Cat. No.422601)?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":186,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eurm","text":"Less background for nuclear staining (e.g.- Foxp3) staining, offering improved signal/noise ratio for better population distinction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3att7","text":"Minimal effects on surface staining, especially those stained using tandem fluorophores such as APC/FIRE™ 750","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq2tj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91shl","text":"I am observing high background staining. What can I do to reduce it?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":68,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fi8ma","text":"Longer fixation time – as noted in the fixation step, a longer fixation period can help ameliorate high background","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fi4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"914bs","text":"Is the True-Nuclear™ Buffer set recommended for intracellular cytokine staining?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":6,"style":"italic"},{"offset":7,"length":73,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2bao","text":"No: The permeabilization conditions required for staining transcription factors using True-Nuclear™ (or Foxp3 Fix/Perm and Nuclear Factor Fixation and Permeabilization Buffer Sets) is much harsher than those recommended for staining cytokines (i.e.- cells become more porous). This can lead to cytokine leakage upon permeabilization, resulting in loss of signal. For staining intracellular cytokines, we recommend using the Fixation (Cat. No. 420801) and Permeabilization Wash Buffers (Cat. No. 421002)and following our intracellular staining protocol, which can be found here.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":424,"length":26,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":455,"length":47,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":424,"length":26,"key":0},{"offset":455,"length":47,"key":1},{"offset":572,"length":4,"key":2}],"data":{}},{"key":"dj725","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r87i","text":"Any known nuclear targets not suited for detection using the True-Nuclear™ buffer?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":82,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hiua","text":"Ki-67: You can find our recommended protocol for Ki-67 staining here","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":64,"length":4,"key":3}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://www.biolegend.com/fixation-buffer-1496.html"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://www.biolegend.com/intracellular-staining-permeabilization-wash-buffer-10x-1497.html"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.biolegend.com/protocols/intracellular-flow-cytometry-staining-protocol/4260/"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.biolegend.com/protocols/ki-67-staining-protocol/4263/"}}}}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"fa687","text":"Perform cell surface staining as described in BioLegend's Cell Surface Immunofluorescence Staining Protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":58,"length":50,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/view\/Immunofluorescence-Staining-ezvbf66"}}],"guid":"CD8E9CFD7B4444A98218EBB8113A41F1","id":665323,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":null}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2e8lj","text":"Add 1mL of the True-Nuclear\u2122 1X Fix Concentrate to each tube, vortex and incubate at room temperature in the dark for 45-60 minutes.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":133,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"7s5tt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fgls3","text":"Tip: Longer fixation time (between 50-60 minutes) is recommended to reduce background staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aomv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1jrm9","text":"If necessary, the protocol can be suspended at this point. After discarding supernatant, re-suspend cells in CytoLast\u2122 Buffer (Cat. No.422501) or equivalent. Samples can be stored at 4\u00b0C for 12-18 hours, protected from light and plastic-wrapped to protect buffer evaporation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":135,"length":6,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":135,"length":6,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5o60h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"17B6FC40BB8611E8AB1883E64ED88B80","duration":3600,"label":"","step_guid":"B7EDD7075F7C46DCB25E4E8F829F313F"}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.biolegend.com\/dwcountry\/products\/cyto-last-buffer-8022"}}],"guid":"B7EDD7075F7C46DCB25E4E8F829F313F","id":665324,"previous_id":665323,"previous_guid":"CD8E9CFD7B4444A98218EBB8113A41F1","section":null}

{"blocks":[{"key":"finsj","text":"Without washing, add 2mL of the True-Nuclear\u2122 1X Perm Buffer to each tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AAF3B7718BED49A3AC4689F01BE976CC","id":665325,"previous_id":665324,"previous_guid":"B7EDD7075F7C46DCB25E4E8F829F313F","section":null}
